sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData.description:
Stores display text together with a navigation target hyperlink.
The LinkData class is used by {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink SmartLink} and {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController SemanticObjectController} to define the visible links on {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover NavigationPopover}.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new navpopover/LinkData. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getText text} : string
    • {@link #getHref href} : string
    • {@link #getTarget target} : string
    • {@link #getDescription description} : string (default: undefined)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getKey key} : string (default: undefined)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData.helpDescription:
Stores display text together with a navigation target hyperlink.
The LinkData class is used by {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink SmartLink} and {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController SemanticObjectController} to define the visible links on {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover NavigationPopover}.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartBulletM.description:
The SmartBulletMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the BulletMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartBulletM.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart/SmartBulletMicroChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getShowLabel showLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string (default: Bullet)
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 164px)
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Associations
    • {@link #getChartTitle chartTitle} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getChartDescription chartDescription} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getUnitOfMeasure unitOfMeasure} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialize initialize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartBulletM.helpDescription:
The SmartBulletMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.BulletMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the BulletMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantMa.description:
The SmartVariantManagement control is a specialization of the {@link sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement VariantManagement} control and communicates with the layer that offers SAPUI5 flexibility services to manage the variants.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.
sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantMa.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SmartVariantManagement.
The call sequence is as follows:
A control for which personalization is used has to be registered first via the personalizableControls association. Then it has to call the initialise method with the arguments fCallback function which will be called once the personalization data has been retrieved and oPersoControl, the control itself.
Note: the function callback has to be defined in the personalizable control.
The old behavior, where the control has to register to the initialise event, before the initialise method call, should not be used any longer and is not supported at all for the page variant scenarios. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getPersonalizableControls personalizableControls} : sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.PersonalizableInfo[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterSave afterSave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement#constructor sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantMa.helpDescription:
The SmartVariantManagement control is a specialization of the {@link sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement VariantManagement} control and communicates with the layer that offers SAPUI5 flexibility services to manage the variants.
For more information about SAPUI5 flexibility, refer to the Developer Guide.

sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBa.description:
The SmartFilterBar control uses the OData metadata of an entity in order to create a filter bar.
Whether a field is visible on the filter bar, supports type-ahead and value help, for example, is automatically determined. When you use control configurations and group configurations it is possible to configure the filter bar and adapt it according to your needs.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBa.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartfilterbar/SmartFilterBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntityType entityType} : string
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getResourceUri resourceUri} : string
    • {@link #getBasicSearchFieldName basicSearchFieldName} : string
    • {@link #getEnableBasicSearch enableBasicSearch} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getLiveMode liveMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowMessages showMessages} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getConsiderAnalyticalParameters considerAnalyticalParameters} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSuppressSelection suppressSelection} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getControlConfiguration controlConfiguration} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfiguration[]
    • {@link #getGroupConfiguration groupConfiguration} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.GroupConfiguration[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSmartVariant smartVariant} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.comp.smartvariants.SmartVariantManagement)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:pendingChange pendingChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar#constructor sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SmartFilterBa.helpDescription:
The SmartFilterBar control uses the OData metadata of an entity in order to create a filter bar.
Whether a field is visible on the filter bar, supports type-ahead and value help, for example, is automatically determined. When you use control configurations and group configurations it is possible to configure the filter bar and adapt it according to your needs.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

controlConfiguration.description: Using control configurations you can add additional configuration to filter fields, for example set custom labels, change the order of fields, or change the filter field control type. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.
controlConfiguration.helpDescription: Using control configurations you can add additional configuration to filter fields, for example set custom labels, change the order of fields, or change the filter field control type. Note: Changing the values here after the SmartFilter is initialized (initialise event was fired) has no effect.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

defaultIndent.description: Optional. Defines default for the whole Grid numbers of empty columns before the current span begins. It can be defined for large, medium and small screens. Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 0 to 11 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M11", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.

useSnapshot.description:
Determines the behavior when reset is executed.
Note: This property is only relevant if no variant management is used, and the filter bar is not used in the advanced mode. A snapshot shows the current state of the filter bar, just before the Filters dialog is opened.
  • undefined (default) defines the standard behavior: snapshot will be applied after reset was triggered
  • false defines that the snapshot will not be applied
  • trueis not considered at all

sap.ui.comp.smartform.Layout.description: Layout settings to adjust the ResponsiveGridLayout used inside the Form.
sap.ui.comp.smartform.Layout.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartform/Layout. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getLabelSpanXL labelSpanXL} : int
    • {@link #getLabelSpanL labelSpanL} : int
    • {@link #getLabelSpanM labelSpanM} : int
    • {@link #getLabelSpanS labelSpanS} : int
    • {@link #getEmptySpanXL emptySpanXL} : int
    • {@link #getEmptySpanL emptySpanL} : int
    • {@link #getEmptySpanM emptySpanM} : int
    • {@link #getEmptySpanS emptySpanS} : int
    • {@link #getColumnsXL columnsXL} : int
    • {@link #getColumnsL columnsL} : int
    • {@link #getColumnsM columnsM} : int
    • {@link #getSingleGroupFullSize singleGroupFullSize} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getBreakpointXL breakpointXL} : int
    • {@link #getBreakpointL breakpointL} : int
    • {@link #getBreakpointM breakpointM} : int
    • {@link #getGridDataSpan gridDataSpan} : sap.ui.layout.GridSpan (default: )
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartform.Layout.helpDescription: Layout settings to adjust the ResponsiveGridLayout used inside the Form.

labelSpanXL.helpDescription: Default span for labels in extra large size.

breakpointL.helpDescription: Breakpoint (in pixel) between Medium size and Large size.

Number of columns for extra large size.

columnsM.helpDescription: Number of columns for medium size.

labelSpanM.description: Default span for labels in medium size. This property is used for full size containers. If more than one Container is in one line, labelSpanL is used.
labelSpanM.helpDescription: Default span for labels in medium size. This property is used for full size containers. If more than one Container is in one line, labelSpanL is used.

singleGroupFullSize.description:
If the SmartForm contains only one single Group and this property is set, the Group is displayed using the full size of the SmartForm. In this case the properties columnsL and columnsM are ignored.
In all other cases the Group is displayed in the size of one column.
singleGroupFullSize.helpDescription:
If the SmartForm contains only one single Group and this property is set, the Group is displayed using the full size of the SmartForm. In this case the properties columnsL and columnsM are ignored.
In all other cases the Group is displayed in the size of one column.

labelSpanL.description: Default span for labels in large size. This span is only used if more than 1 container is in one line, if only 1 container is in the line the labelSpanM value is used.
labelSpanL.helpDescription: Default span for labels in large size. This span is only used if more than 1 container is in one line, if only 1 container is in the line the labelSpanM value is used.

gridDataSpan.description:
A string type that represents Grid's span values for large, medium and small screens. Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 1 to 12 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M12", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.
The value set here will be set to all group elements when used with horizontal layout (SmartForm property useHorizontalLayout)
gridDataSpan.helpDescription:
A string type that represents Grid's span values for large, medium and small screens. Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 1 to 12 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M12", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.
The value set here will be set to all group elements when used with horizontal layout (SmartForm property useHorizontalLayout)

Constructor for a new smartfilterbar/GroupConfiguration. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getIndex index} : any (default: undefined)
    • {@link #getLabel label} : any (default: undefined)
  • Events

In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.

sap.ui.comp.smartfield.Configuration.description: The configuration allows to further define the behavior of a SmartField.
sap.ui.comp.smartfield.Configuration.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartfield/Configuration. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getControlType controlType} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlType
    • {@link #getDisplayBehaviour displayBehaviour} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.DisplayBehaviour
    • {@link #getPreventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog} : boolean (default: true)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartfield.Configuration.helpDescription: The configuration allows to further define the behavior of a SmartField.

The default value is true, which means the table will not be filled as the data fetch is prevented.

The default value is true, which means the table will not be filled as the data fetch is prevented.

sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SelectOption.description: A Select Option can be used to specify default filter values for a control configuration of the SmartFilterBar.
sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SelectOption.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartfilterbar/SelectOption. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSign sign} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SelectOptionSign (default: I)
    • {@link #getOperator operator} : sap.ui.model.FilterOperator (default: EQ)
    • {@link #getLow low} : string
    • {@link #getHigh high} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SelectOption.helpDescription: A Select Option can be used to specify default filter values for a control configuration of the SmartFilterBar.

sap.ui.comp.variants.EditableVariantItem.description: The EditableVariantItem class describes an editable variant list item for the Manage Variants popup.
sap.ui.comp.variants.EditableVariantItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new variants/EditableVariantItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getGlobal global} : boolean
    • {@link #getLifecyclePackage lifecyclePackage} : string
    • {@link #getLifecycleTransportId lifecycleTransportId} : string
    • {@link #getNamespace namespace} : string
    • {@link #getReadOnly readOnly} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAccessOptions accessOptions} : string
    • {@link #getLabelReadOnly labelReadOnly} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getAuthor author} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ColumnListItem#constructor sap.m.ColumnListItem} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.variants.EditableVariantItem.helpDescription: The EditableVariantItem class describes an editable variant list item for the Manage Variants popup.

sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar.description:
The control displays filters in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The FilterBar consists of a row containing the {@link sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement VariantManagement} control, the related buttons, and an area underneath displaying the filters. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The area containing the filters can be hidden or shown using the Hide Filter Bar / Show Filter Bar button. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Filters button shows the filter dialog.
In this dialog, the consumer has full control over the filter bar. The filters in this dialog are displayed in one column and organized in groups. The filter items of the filterItems aggregation are grouped in the Basic group . Each filter can be marked as visible in the filter bar by selecting Add to Filter Bar. In addition, the items in the filterGroupItems aggregation can be marked as part of the current variant. The FilterBar also supports a different UI layout when used inside a value help dialog. In this case the FilterBar consists of two logical areas, one containing the general search button and in the Advanced Search area. The Advanced Search is a collapsible area displaying the advanced filters in two columns.
sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new FilterBar. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey} : string
    • {@link #getAdvancedMode advancedMode} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getExpandAdvancedArea expandAdvancedArea} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSearchEnabled searchEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFilterBarExpanded filterBarExpanded} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getConsiderGroupTitle considerGroupTitle} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowClearButton showClearButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowRestoreButton showRestoreButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowGoOnFB showGoOnFB} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowRestoreOnFB showRestoreOnFB} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowClearOnFB showClearOnFB} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowGoButton showGoButton} : boolean
    • {@link #getDeltaVariantMode deltaVariantMode} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFilterContainerWidth filterContainerWidth} : string (default: 12rem)
    • {@link #getUseToolbar useToolbar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeader header} : string
    • {@link #getShowFilterConfiguration showFilterConfiguration} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseSnapshot useSnapshot} : boolean
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFilterItems filterItems} : sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterItem[]
    • {@link #getFilterGroupItems filterGroupItems} : sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterGroupItem[]
  • Associations
    • {@link #getBasicSearch basicSearch} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.SearchField)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:reset reset} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:search search} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeVariantSave beforeVariantSave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeVariantFetch beforeVariantFetch} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantLoad afterVariantLoad} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filterChange filterChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:clear clear} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialized initialized} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantSave afterVariantSave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:filtersDialogClosed filtersDialogClosed} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:assignedFiltersChanged assignedFiltersChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.layout.Grid#constructor sap.ui.layout.Grid} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar.helpDescription:
The control displays filters in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The FilterBar consists of a row containing the {@link sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement VariantManagement} control, the related buttons, and an area underneath displaying the filters. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The area containing the filters can be hidden or shown using the Hide Filter Bar / Show Filter Bar button. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Filters button shows the filter dialog.
In this dialog, the consumer has full control over the filter bar. The filters in this dialog are displayed in one column and organized in groups. The filter items of the filterItems aggregation are grouped in the Basic group . Each filter can be marked as visible in the filter bar by selecting Add to Filter Bar. In addition, the items in the filterGroupItems aggregation can be marked as part of the current variant. The FilterBar also supports a different UI layout when used inside a value help dialog. In this case the FilterBar consists of two logical areas, one containing the general search button and in the Advanced Search area. The Advanced Search is a collapsible area displaying the advanced filters in two columns.

If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

defaultIndent.description: Optional. Defines default for the whole Grid numbers of empty columns before the current span begins. It can be defined for large, medium and small screens. Allowed values are separated by space Letters L, M or S followed by number of columns from 0 to 11 that the container has to take, for example: "L2 M4 S6", "M11", "s10" or "l4 m4". Note that the parameters has to be provided in the order large medium small.

useSnapshot.description:
Determines the behavior when reset is executed.
Note: This property is only relevant if no variant management is used, and the filter bar is not used in the advanced mode. A snapshot shows the current state of the filter bar, just before the Filters dialog is opened.
  • undefined (default) defines the standard behavior: snapshot will be applied after reset was triggered
  • false defines that the snapshot will not be applied
  • trueis not considered at all

sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectCon.description: The SemanticObjectController allows the user to register against semantic object navigation events as well as define semantic objects which should be ignored.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectCon.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new navpopover/SemanticObjectController. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields} : string
    • {@link #getPrefetchNavigationTargets prefetchNavigationTargets} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getFieldSemanticObjectMap fieldSemanticObjectMap} : object
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getContactAnnotationPaths contactAnnotationPaths} : object
    • {@link #getEnableAvailableActionsPersonalization enableAvailableActionsPersonalization} : object
  • Events
    • {@link #event:navigationTargetsObtained navigationTargetsObtained} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforePopoverOpens beforePopoverOpens} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:prefetchDone prefetchDone} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectCon.helpDescription: The SemanticObjectController allows the user to register against semantic object navigation events as well as define semantic objects which should be ignored.

Deprecated! Since 1.42.0 The property prefetchNavigationTargets is obsolete as navigation targets are determined automatically. The SmartLink controls are re-rendered as soon as the asynchronous determination of navigation targets has been completed.

sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement.description: The VariantManagement control can be used to manage variants, such as filter bar variants or table variants.
sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new VariantManagement. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getInitialSelectionKey initialSelectionKey} : string
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDefaultVariantKey defaultVariantKey} : string
    • {@link #getSelectionKey selectionKey} : string
    • {@link #getShowCreateTile showCreateTile} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowExecuteOnSelection showExecuteOnSelection} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowShare showShare} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowSetAsDefault showSetAsDefault} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLifecycleSupport lifecycleSupport} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getStandardItemText standardItemText} : string
    • {@link #getIndustrySolutionMode industrySolutionMode} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getItems items} : sap.ui.core.Item[] (default)
    • {@link #getVariantItems variantItems} : sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantItem[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:save save} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:manage manage} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:select select} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.variants.VariantManagement.helpDescription: The VariantManagement control can be used to manage variants, such as filter bar variants or table variants.

sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover.description: The NavigationPopover control is used to present information in a specific format. Note: This control is used by the {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopoverHandler NavigationPopoverHandler} and must not be used manually.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new navpopover/NavigationPopover. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectName semanticObjectName} : string
    • {@link #getSemanticAttributes semanticAttributes} : object
    • {@link #getAppStateKey appStateKey} : string
    • {@link #getMainNavigationId mainNavigationId} : string
    • {@link #getAvailableActionsPersonalizationText availableActionsPersonalizationText} : string (default: undefined)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getAvailableActions availableActions} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[]
    • {@link #getMainNavigation mainNavigation} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData
    • {@link #getOwnNavigation ownNavigation} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSource source} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
    • {@link #getExtraContent extraContent} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
    • {@link #getComponent component} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Element)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:targetsObtained targetsObtained} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigate navigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:availableActionsPersonalizationPress availableActionsPersonalizationPress} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.ResponsivePopover#constructor sap.m.ResponsivePopover} can be used as well.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroCh.description:
The SmartMicroChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet property must be specified in order to use the control. This property is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Depending on the UI/ChartType annotation, the control creates a corresponding SmartBulletMicroChart or SmartAreaMicroChart instance and delegates to the internal control.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroCh.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart/SmartMicroChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getShowLabel showLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 164px)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 74px)
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Associations
    • {@link #getChartTitle chartTitle} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getChartDescription chartDescription} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getUnitOfMeasure unitOfMeasure} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getFreeText freeText} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialize initialize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartMicroCh.helpDescription:
The SmartMicroChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet property must be specified in order to use the control. This property is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Depending on the UI/ChartType annotation, the control creates a corresponding SmartBulletMicroChart or SmartAreaMicroChart instance and delegates to the internal control.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm.description: The SmartForm control renders a form (sap.ui.layout.form.Form) and supports key user personalization, such as adding/hiding fields and groups, changing the order of fields and groups, and changing labels. When used with the SmartField control the label is taken from the metadata annotation sap:label if not specified in the XML view.
sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartform/SmartForm. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getTitle title} : string
    • {@link #getUseHorizontalLayout useHorizontalLayout} : boolean
    • {@link #getHorizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth horizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth} : int
    • {@link #getCheckButton checkButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEntityType entityType} : string
    • {@link #getExpandable expandable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getExpanded expanded} : boolean
    • {@link #getEditTogglable editTogglable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields} : string
    • {@link #getFlexEnabled flexEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGroups groups} : sap.ui.comp.smartform.Group[] (default)
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : sap.ui.comp.smartform.Layout
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController
    • {@link #getCustomToolbar customToolbar} : sap.m.Toolbar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:editToggled editToggled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:checked checked} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartform.SmartForm.helpDescription: The SmartForm control renders a form (sap.ui.layout.form.Form) and supports key user personalization, such as adding/hiding fields and groups, changing the order of fields and groups, and changing labels. sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterItem.description: Represents a filter belonging to the basic group.
sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new filterbar/FilterItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getMandatory mandatory} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLabelTooltip labelTooltip} : string
    • {@link #getPartOfCurrentVariant partOfCurrentVariant} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getVisibleInFilterBar visibleInFilterBar} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHiddenFilter hiddenFilter} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getControl control} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterItem.helpDescription: Represents a filter belonging to the basic group.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMic.description:
The SmartAreaMicroChart control creates a AreaMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which Micro Area Chart UI will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialised.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMic.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart/SmartAreaMicroChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getShowLabel showLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 164px)
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize (default: 74px)
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Associations
    • {@link #getChartTitle chartTitle} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getChartDescription chartDescription} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getUnitOfMeasure unitOfMeasure} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialize initialize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartAreaMic.helpDescription:
The SmartAreaMicroChart control creates a AreaMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which Micro Area Chart UI will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialised.

sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfig.description: ControlConfiguration can be used to add additional configuration for filter fields in the SmartFilterBar control, in order to overwrite the default settings from the OData metadata. For instance, it is possible to change the label, index or control type of a filter field.
sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfig.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartfilterbar/ControlConfiguration. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getGroupId groupId} : string
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string
    • {@link #getVisible visible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHasValueHelpDialog hasValueHelpDialog} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getControlType controlType} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlType (default: auto)
    • {@link #getFilterType filterType} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.FilterType (default: auto)
    • {@link #getIndex index} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getHasTypeAhead hasTypeAhead} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getMandatory mandatory} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.MandatoryType (default: auto)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : string
    • {@link #getVisibleInAdvancedArea visibleInAdvancedArea} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getPreventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog preventInitialDataFetchInValueHelpDialog} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getDisplayBehaviour displayBehaviour} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour (default: auto)
    • {@link #getConditionType conditionType} : any
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getDefaultFilterValues defaultFilterValues} : sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.SelectOption[]
    • {@link #getCustomControl customControl} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Element#constructor sap.ui.core.Element} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.ControlConfig.helpDescription: ControlConfiguration can be used to add additional configuration for filter fields in the SmartFilterBar control, in order to overwrite the default settings from the OData metadata. For instance, it is possible to change the label, index or control type of a filter field.

sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink.description: The SmartLink control uses a semantic object to display {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover NavigationPopover} for further navigation steps.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new navpopover/SmartLink. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSemanticObject semanticObject} : string
    • {@link #getAdditionalSemanticObjects additionalSemanticObjects} : string[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : any
    • {@link #getFieldName fieldName} : string
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectLabel semanticObjectLabel} : string
    • {@link #getCreateControlCallback createControlCallback} : object
    • {@link #getMapFieldToSemanticObject mapFieldToSemanticObject} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getContactAnnotationPath contactAnnotationPath} : string (default: undefined)
    • {@link #getIgnoreLinkRendering ignoreLinkRendering} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableAvailableActionsPersonalization enableAvailableActionsPersonalization} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getInnerControl innerControl} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:beforePopoverOpens beforePopoverOpens} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigationTargetsObtained navigationTargetsObtained} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:innerNavigate innerNavigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Link#constructor sap.m.Link} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SmartLink.helpDescription: The SmartLink control uses a semantic object to display {@link sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover NavigationPopover} for further navigation steps.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

href.description: The link target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior. If a JavaScript action should be triggered, this should not be set, but instead an event handler for the "press" event should be registered.
href.helpDescription: The link target URI. Supports standard hyperlink behavior. If a JavaScript action should be triggered, this should not be set, but instead an event handler for the "press" event should be registered.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

semanticObject.description: Name of semantic object which is used to fill the navigation popover. Note: Setting a value triggers an asynchronous determination, so the effect can be delayed.
semanticObject.helpDescription: Name of semantic object which is used to fill the navigation popover. Note: Setting a value triggers an asynchronous determination, so the effect can be delayed.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

createControlCallback.description: Function that enables the SmartLink control to create an alternative control, which is displayed if no navigation targets are available. The function has no parameters and has to return an instance of sap.ui.core.Control.
createControlCallback.helpDescription: Function that enables the SmartLink control to create an alternative control, which is displayed if no navigation targets are available. The function has no parameters and has to return an instance of sap.ui.core.Control.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

textAlign.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the text.
textAlign.helpDescription: Sets the horizontal alignment of the text.

wrapping.description: Determines whether the link text is allowed to wrap when there is not sufficient space.
wrapping.helpDescription: Determines whether the link text is allowed to wrap when there is not sufficient space.

target.description: Options are the standard values for window.open() supported by browsers: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered. This property is only used when the href property is set.
target.helpDescription: Options are the standard values for window.open() supported by browsers: _self, _top, _blank, _parent, _search. Alternatively, a frame name can be entered. This property is only used when the href property is set.

subtle.description: Subtle links look more like standard text than like links. They should only be used to help with visual hierarchy between large data lists of important and less important links. Subtle links should not be used in any other use case.
subtle.helpDescription: Subtle links look more like standard text than like links. They should only be used to help with visual hierarchy between large data lists of important and less important links. Subtle links should not be used in any other use case.

width.description: Width of the link (CSS-size such as % or px). When it is set, this is the exact size. When left blank, the text defines the size.
width.helpDescription: Width of the link (CSS-size such as % or px). When it is set, this is the exact size. When left blank, the text defines the size.

semanticObjectController.description: The semantic object controller controls events for several SmartLink controls. If the controller is not set manually, it tries to find a SemanticObjectController in its parent hierarchy.
semanticObjectController.helpDescription: The semantic object controller controls events for several SmartLink controls. If the controller is not set manually, it tries to find a SemanticObjectController in its parent hierarchy.

innerNavigate.name: innerNavigate
innerNavigate.description: This event is fired after a navigation link on the navigation popover has been clicked. This event is only fired, if the user left-clicks the link. Right-clicking the link and selecting 'Open in New Window' etc. in the context menu does not fire the event.
innerNavigate.helpDescription: This event is fired after a navigation link on the navigation popover has been clicked. This event is only fired, if the user left-clicks the link. Right-clicking the link and selecting 'Open in New Window' etc. in the context menu does not fire the event.
innerNavigate.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

beforePopoverOpens.name: beforePopoverOpens
beforePopoverOpens.description: Event is fired before the navigation popover opens and before navigation target links are getting retrieved. Event can be used to change the parameters used to retrieve the navigation targets. In case of SmartLink, the beforePopoverOpens is fired after the link has been clicked.
beforePopoverOpens.helpDescription: Event is fired before the navigation popover opens and before navigation target links are getting retrieved. Event can be used to change the parameters used to retrieve the navigation targets. In case of SmartLink, the beforePopoverOpens is fired after the link has been clicked.
beforePopoverOpens.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.ownNavigatio: type: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData, description: The navigation object for the own application. This navigation option is by default not visible on the popover.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.popoverForms: type: [object Object][], description: Array containing contact data.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.actions: type: [object Object][], description: Array of available navigation target objects.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.mainNavigati: type: sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData, description: The main navigation object.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.originalId: type: string, description: The ID of the SmartLink.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.show:
type: function, description: This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show() show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
  • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
  • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
  • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
  • {string | null | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With null, the description for the main navigation link is calculated using binding context of given source object (for example SmartLink). With undefined the old description will remain.
  • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
  • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
  • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.semanticObje: type: string, description: The semantic object for which the navigation targets have been retrieved.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.semanticAttr: type: object, description: Map containing the semantic attributes.

navigationTargetsObtained.description: After the navigation targets are retrieved, navigationTargetsObtained is fired and provides the possibility to change the targets.

navigationTargetsObtained.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartLabel.description: The SmartLabel control extends {@link sap.m.Label sap.m.Label} and displays the label for {@link sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField SmartField}. It uses the annotations sap:label or com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Label for the label text and sap:quickinfo or com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.QuickInfo for the tooltip. The mandatory indicator is obtained from the SmartField control. The association with a SmartField control is built using the setLabelFor method.

sap.ui.comp.smartform.Group.description: Groups are used to group group elements.
sap.ui.comp.smartform.Group.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartform/Group. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getUseHorizontalLayout useHorizontalLayout} : boolean
    • {@link #getHorizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth horizontalLayoutGroupElementMinWidth} : int
    • {@link #getLabel label} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getGroupElements groupElements} : sap.ui.comp.smartform.GroupElement[] (default)
    • {@link #getLayout layout} : sap.ui.layout.GridData
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.layout.form.FormContainer#constructor sap.ui.layout.form.FormContainer} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartform.Group.helpDescription: Groups are used to group group elements.

Constructor for a new smartvariants/PersonalizableInfo. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

    • {@link #getKeyName keyName} : string

sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover.description: The NavigationPopoverHandler control determines target navigations for a semantic object and shows them together with further information in a Popover. Target navigations are determined via the {@link sap.ushell.services.CrossApplicationNavigation CrossApplicationNavigation} service of the unified shell.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new navpopover/NavigationPopoverHandler. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getSemanticObject semanticObject} : string
    • {@link #getAdditionalSemanticObjects additionalSemanticObjects} : string[] (default: [])
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : any
    • {@link #getFieldName fieldName} : string
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectLabel semanticObjectLabel} : string
    • {@link #getMapFieldToSemanticObject mapFieldToSemanticObject} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSemanticAttributes semanticAttributes} : object
    • {@link #getContactAnnotationPath contactAnnotationPath} : string (default: undefined)
    • {@link #getEnableAvailableActionsPersonalization enableAvailableActionsPersonalization} : boolean (default: true)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getControl control} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:beforePopoverOpens beforePopoverOpens} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:navigationTargetsObtained navigationTargetsObtained} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:innerNavigate innerNavigate} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor sap.ui.base.ManagedObject} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.navpopover.NavigationPopover.helpDescription: The NavigationPopoverHandler control determines target navigations for a semantic object and shows them together with further information in a Popover. Target navigations are determined via the {@link sap.ushell.services.CrossApplicationNavigation CrossApplicationNavigation} service of the unified shell.

eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.originalId: type: string, description: The ID of the NavigationPopoverHandler.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.show:
type: function, description: This callback function shows the actual navigation popover. If the navigationTargetsObtained has been registered, the show function has to be called manually in order to open the navigation popover. Signatures: show() show(oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
  • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
  • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
  • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.
show(sMainNavigationId, oMainNavigation, aAvailableActions, oAdditionalContent) Parameters:
  • {string | null | undefined} sMainNavigationId The visible description for the main navigation link. With null, the description for the main navigation link is calculated using binding context of given source object (for example SmartLink). With undefined the old description will remain.
  • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData | null | undefined} oMainNavigation The main navigation object. With null the main navigation object will be removed. With undefined the old object will remain.
  • {sap.ui.comp.navpopover.LinkData[] | [] | undefined} aAvailableActions Array containing the cross application navigation links. With empty array all available links will be removed. With undefined the old links will remain.
  • {sap.ui.core.Control | null | undefined} oAdditionalContent Control that will be displayed in extra content section on the popover. With null the main extra content object will be removed. With undefined the old object still remains.

initialFocus.description: Focus is set to the dialog in the sequence of leftButton and rightButton when available. But if some other control needs to get the focus other than one of those two buttons, set the initialFocus with the control which should be focused on. Setting initialFocus to input controls doesn't open the on screen keyboard on mobile device, this is due to the browser limitation that the on screen keyboard can't be opened with javascript code. The opening of on screen keyboard must be triggered by real user action.
initialFocus.helpDescription: Focus is set to the dialog in the sequence of leftButton and rightButton when available. But if some other control needs to get the focus other than one of those two buttons, set the initialFocus with the control which should be focused on. Setting initialFocus to input controls doesn't open the on screen keyboard on mobile device, this is due to the browser limitation that the on screen keyboard can't be opened with javascript code. The opening of on screen keyboard must be triggered by real user action.

leftButton.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 LeftButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
LeftButton is shown at the left edge of the bar in iOS, and at the right side of the bar for the other platforms. Please set this to null if you want to remove the left button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting leftButton will also set the beginButton internally.
leftButton.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 LeftButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
LeftButton is shown at the left edge of the bar in iOS, and at the right side of the bar for the other platforms. Please set this to null if you want to remove the left button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting leftButton will also set the beginButton internally.

DeprecatedInfo.description: LeftButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead which is more RTL friendly.

rightButton.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 RightButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the endButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
RightButton is always shown at the right edge of the bar. Please set this to null if you want to remove the right button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting rightButton will also set the endButton internally.
rightButton.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 RightButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the endButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
RightButton is always shown at the right edge of the bar. Please set this to null if you want to remove the right button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting rightButton will also set the endButton internally.

DeprecatedInfo.description: RightButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the endButton instead which is more RTL friendly.

sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpDia.description: The ValueHelpDialog control can be used to implement a value help for an input field.
sap.ui.comp.valuehelpdialog.ValueHelpDia.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new valuehelpdialog/ValueHelpDialog. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getBasicSearchText basicSearchText} : string
    • {@link #getSupportMultiselect supportMultiselect} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSupportRanges supportRanges} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSupportRangesOnly supportRangesOnly} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getKey key} : string
    • {@link #getKeys keys} : string[]
    • {@link #getDescriptionKey descriptionKey} : string
    • {@link #getMaxIncludeRanges maxIncludeRanges} : string (default: -1)
    • {@link #getMaxExcludeRanges maxExcludeRanges} : string (default: -1)
    • {@link #getDisplayFormat displayFormat} : string
    • {@link #getTokenDisplayBehaviour tokenDisplayBehaviour} : string
    • {@link #getFilterMode filterMode} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFilterBar filterBar} : sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterBar
  • Events
    • {@link #event:ok ok} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tokenRemove tokenRemove} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:updateSelection updateSelection} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Dialog#constructor sap.m.Dialog} can be used as well.

buttons.description: Buttons can be added to the footer area of dialog through this aggregation. When this aggregation is set, any change to beginButton and endButton has no effect anymore. Buttons which are inside this aggregation are aligned at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer instead of in the middle of the footer.
buttons.helpDescription: Buttons can be added to the footer area of dialog through this aggregation. When this aggregation is set, any change to beginButton and endButton has no effect anymore. Buttons which are inside this aggregation are aligned at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer instead of in the middle of the footer.

beginButton.description: The button which is rendered to the left side (right side in RTL mode) of the endButton in the footer area inside the dialog. From UI5 version 1.21.1, there's a new aggregation "buttons" created with which more than 2 buttons can be added to the footer area of dialog. If the new "buttons" aggregation is set, any change made to this aggregation has no effect anymore. When runs on the phone, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the center of the footer area. When runs on the other platforms, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer area.

horizontalScrolling.description: Indicates if user can scroll horizontally inside dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as direct child added to dialog. If there is, dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.
