objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

escapeHandler.description:
This property expects a function with one parameter of type Promise. In the function you should call either resolve() or reject() on the Promise object.
The function allows you to define custom behaviour which will be executed when the ESCAPE key is pressed. By default when the ESCAPE key is pressed the Dialog is immediately closed.
escapeHandler.helpDescription:
This property expects a function with one parameter of type Promise. In the function you should call either resolve() or reject() on the Promise object.
The function allows you to define custom behaviour which will be executed when the ESCAPE key is pressed. By default when the ESCAPE key is pressed the Dialog is immediately closed.

keys.description: Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.
keys.helpDescription: Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.

maxIncludeRanges.description: Defines the maximum number of include ranges.
maxIncludeRanges.helpDescription: Defines the maximum number of include ranges.

icon.description: Icon displayed in the dialog's header. This icon is invisible on the iOS platform and it's density aware. You can use the density convention (@2, @1.5, etc.) to provide higher resolution image for higher density screen.
icon.helpDescription: Icon displayed in the dialog's header. This icon is invisible on the iOS platform and it's density aware. You can use the density convention (@2, @1.5, etc.) to provide higher resolution image for higher density screen.

title.description: Title text appears in the dialog header.
title.helpDescription: Title text appears in the dialog header.

type.description: The type of the dialog. In theme sap_bluecrystal, the type "message" will limit the dialog's width within 480px on tablet and desktop.
type.helpDescription: The type of the dialog. In theme sap_bluecrystal, the type "message" will limit the dialog's width within 480px on tablet and desktop.

supportMultiselect.description: Enables multi-selection in the table used.
supportMultiselect.helpDescription: Enables multi-selection in the table used.

maxExcludeRanges.description: Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges.
maxExcludeRanges.helpDescription: Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges.

tokenDisplayBehaviour.description: Represents how the item token text should be displayed in ValueHelpDialog. Use one of the valid sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour values.
tokenDisplayBehaviour.helpDescription: Represents how the item token text should be displayed in ValueHelpDialog. Use one of the valid sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour values.

stretch.description: Determines if the dialog will be stretched to full screen. This property is only applicable to standard dialog and message type dialog ignores this property.
stretch.helpDescription: Determines if the dialog will be stretched to full screen. This property is only applicable to standard dialog and message type dialog ignores this property.

filterMode.description: Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens.
filterMode.helpDescription: Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens.

contentWidth.description: Preferred width of content in Dialog. This property affects the width of dialog on phone in landscape mode, tablet or desktop, because the dialog has a fixed width on phone in portrait mode. If the preferred width is less than the minimum width of dilaog or more than the available width of the screen, it will be overwritten by the min or max value. The current mininum value of dialog width on tablet is 400px.
contentWidth.helpDescription: Preferred width of content in Dialog. This property affects the width of dialog on phone in landscape mode, tablet or desktop, because the dialog has a fixed width on phone in portrait mode. If the preferred width is less than the minimum width of dilaog or more than the available width of the screen, it will be overwritten by the min or max value. The current mininum value of dialog width on tablet is 400px.

draggable.description: Indicates whether the dialog is draggable. If this property is set to true, the dialog will be draggable by it's header. This property has a default value false. The Dialog can be draggable only in desktop mode.
draggable.helpDescription: Indicates whether the dialog is draggable. If this property is set to true, the dialog will be draggable by it's header. This property has a default value false. The Dialog can be draggable only in desktop mode.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#attachValidateFieldGroup}.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#attachValidateFieldGroup}.

state.description: The state affects the icon and the title color. If other than "None" is set, a predefined icon will be added to the dialog. Setting icon property will overwrite the predefined icon. The default value is "None" which doesn't add any icon to the Dialog control. This property is by now only supported by blue crystal theme.
state.helpDescription: The state affects the icon and the title color. If other than "None" is set, a predefined icon will be added to the dialog. Setting icon property will overwrite the predefined icon. The default value is "None" which doesn't add any icon to the Dialog control. This property is by now only supported by blue crystal theme.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

key.description: Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table.
key.helpDescription: Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

stretchOnPhone.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.13.1 Please use the new stretch property instead. This enables a stretched dialog even on tablet and desktop. If you want to achieve the same effect as stretchOnPhone, please set the stretch with jQuery.device.is.phone, then dialog is only stretched when runs on phone.
Determines whether the dialog will displayed on full screen on a phone.
stretchOnPhone.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.13.1 Please use the new stretch property instead. This enables a stretched dialog even on tablet and desktop. If you want to achieve the same effect as stretchOnPhone, please set the stretch with jQuery.device.is.phone, then dialog is only stretched when runs on phone.
Determines whether the dialog will displayed on full screen on a phone.

DeprecatedInfo.description: Please use the new stretch property instead. This enables a stretched dialog even on tablet and desktop. If you want to achieve the same effect as stretchOnPhone, please set the stretch with jQuery.device.is.phone, then dialog is only stretched when runs on phone.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

verticalScrolling.description: Indicates if user can scroll vertically inside dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as direct child added to dialog. If there is, dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.
verticalScrolling.helpDescription: Indicates if user can scroll vertically inside dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as direct child added to dialog. If there is, dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.

resizable.description: Indicates whether the dialog is resizable. the dialog is resizable. If this property is set to true, the dialog will have a resize handler in it's bottom right corner. This property has a default value false. The Dialog can be resizable only in desktop mode.
resizable.helpDescription: Indicates whether the dialog is resizable. the dialog is resizable. If this property is set to true, the dialog will have a resize handler in it's bottom right corner. This property has a default value false. The Dialog can be resizable only in desktop mode.

showHeader.description: Determines whether the header is shown inside the dialog. If this property is set to true, the text and icon property are ignored. This property has a default value true.
showHeader.helpDescription: Determines whether the header is shown inside the dialog. If this property is set to true, the text and icon property are ignored. This property has a default value true.

supportRangesOnly.description: If this property is set to true, the value help dialog only supports the ranges (conditions) feature.
supportRangesOnly.helpDescription: If this property is set to true, the value help dialog only supports the ranges (conditions) feature.

descriptionKey.description: Defines the key of the column used for the token text.
descriptionKey.helpDescription: Defines the key of the column used for the token text.

basicSearchText.description: Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used.
basicSearchText.helpDescription: Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used.

displayFormat.description: Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters.
displayFormat.helpDescription: Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters.

contentHeight.description: Preferred height of content in Dialog. If the preferred height is bigger than the available space on screen, it will be overwritten by the maximum available height on screen in order to make sure that dialog isn't cut off.
contentHeight.helpDescription: Preferred height of content in Dialog. If the preferred height is bigger than the available space on screen, it will be overwritten by the maximum available height on screen in order to make sure that dialog isn't cut off.

supportRanges.description: Enables the ranges (conditions) feature in the dialog.
supportRanges.helpDescription: Enables the ranges (conditions) feature in the dialog.

sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField.description: The SmartField control is a wrapper for other controls. It interprets OData metadata to determine the control that has to be instantiated. The OData entity is derived from the control's binding context. The OData entity's property that is changed or displayed with the control is derived from the control's value property.
sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartfield/SmartField. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getValue value} : any
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getContextEditable contextEditable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getTextAlign textAlign} : sap.ui.core.TextAlign (default: Initial)
    • {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder} : string
    • {@link #getName name} : string
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getValueStateText valueStateText} : string
    • {@link #getShowValueStateMessage showValueStateMessage} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getJsontype jsontype} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.JSONType
    • {@link #getMandatory mandatory} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getMaxLength maxLength} : int (default: 0)
    • {@link #getShowSuggestion showSuggestion} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowValueHelp showValueHelp} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowLabel showLabel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getTextLabel textLabel} : string
    • {@link #getTooltipLabel tooltipLabel} : string
    • {@link #getUomVisible uomVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUomEditable uomEditable} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUomEnabled uomEnabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUrl url} : string
    • {@link #getUomEditState uomEditState} : int (default: -1)
    • {@link #getControlContext controlContext} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlContextType (default: None)
    • {@link #getProposedControl proposedControl} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlProposalType (default: None)
    • {@link #getWrapping wrapping} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getClientSideMandatoryCheck clientSideMandatoryCheck} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getFetchValueListReadOnly fetchValueListReadOnly} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getConfiguration configuration} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.Configuration
    • {@link #getControlProposal controlProposal} : sap.ui.comp.smartfield.ControlProposal
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
  • Events
    • {@link #event:entitySetFound entitySetFound} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:visibleChanged visibleChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:editableChanged editableChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:contextEditableChanged contextEditableChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:innerControlsCreated innerControlsCreated} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:valueListChanged valueListChanged} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:press press} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartfield.SmartField.helpDescription: The SmartField control is a wrapper for other controls. It interprets OData metadata to determine the control that has to be instantiated. The OData entity is derived from the control's binding context. The OData entity's property that is changed or displayed with the control is derived from the control's value property.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

fetchValueListReadOnly.description: Determines whether the SmartField control fetches its value list to display the description for a given key (value property) in read-only mode. If the value list is not fetched by the read-only SmartField control, the application has to make sure that the description is requested and made available, for example, by using $expand. In this case the SmartField control will display the description if the path to the description has been set using the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation.
fetchValueListReadOnly.helpDescription: Determines whether the SmartField control fetches its value list to display the description for a given key (value property) in read-only mode. If the value list is not fetched by the read-only SmartField control, the application has to make sure that the description is requested and made available, for example, by using $expand. In this case the SmartField control will display the description if the path to the description has been set using the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text annotation.

sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartRadialM.description:
The SmartRadialMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.RadialMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the RadialMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartRadialM.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart/SmartRadialMicroChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string (default: Donut)
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getIsResponsive isResponsive} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
  • Associations
    • {@link #getChartTitle chartTitle} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getChartDescription chartDescription} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getUnitOfMeasure unitOfMeasure} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
    • {@link #getFreeText freeText} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.m.Label)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialize initialize} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartmicrochart.SmartRadialM.helpDescription:
The SmartRadialMicroChart control creates a sap.suite.ui.microchart.RadialMicroChart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified by mSettings. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch metadata and annotation information from the given default OData model. Based on this, the RadialMicroChart UI is created.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.description:
The SmartTable control creates a table based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which columns will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual table data.
Based on the tableType property, this control will render a standard, analytical, tree, or responsive table.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smarttable/SmartTable. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getSmartFilterId smartFilterId} : string
    • {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields} : string
    • {@link #getInitiallyVisibleFields initiallyVisibleFields} : string
    • {@link #getRequestAtLeastFields requestAtLeastFields} : string
    • {@link #getIgnoreFromPersonalisation ignoreFromPersonalisation} : string
    • {@link #getTableType tableType} : sap.ui.comp.smarttable.TableType
    • {@link #getUseVariantManagement useVariantManagement} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowVariantManagement showVariantManagement} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseExportToExcel useExportToExcel} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseTablePersonalisation useTablePersonalisation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowTablePersonalisation showTablePersonalisation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowRowCount showRowCount} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeader header} : string
    • {@link #getToolbarStyleClass toolbarStyleClass} : string
    • {@link #getEnableCustomFilter enableCustomFilter} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey} : string
    • {@link #getUseOnlyOneSolidToolbar useOnlyOneSolidToolbar} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getCurrentVariantId currentVariantId} : string
    • {@link #getEditable editable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getTableBindingPath tableBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getEditTogglable editTogglable} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getDemandPopin demandPopin} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowFullScreenButton showFullScreenButton} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getCustomToolbar customToolbar} : sap.m.Toolbar
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController
    • {@link #getNoData noData} : sap.ui.core.Control|string
    • {@link #getSemanticKeyAdditionalControl semanticKeyAdditionalControl} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSmartVariant smartVariant} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeRebindTable beforeRebindTable} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:editToggled editToggled} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataReceived dataReceived} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantInitialise afterVariantInitialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantSave afterVariantSave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantApply afterVariantApply} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showOverlay showOverlay} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:fieldChange fieldChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.VBox#constructor sap.m.VBox} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smarttable.SmartTable.helpDescription:
The SmartTable control creates a table based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet attribute must be specified to use the control. This attribute is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which columns will be generated; it can also be used to fetch the actual table data.
Based on the tableType property, this control will render a standard, analytical, tree, or responsive table.
Note:
Most of the attributes/properties are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

Note:

enableCustomFilter.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.40.0 After personalization dialog has been introduced in SmartTable the property enableCustomFilter does not make sense. When setting the property to false, the entered custom filter value will not be shown in personalization dialog and will also not be persisted in variant management. The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.
Can be used to override the filter behavior. If set to true (default), instead of the filter input box a button is rendered. When pressing this button, the SmartTable control opens the filter panel directly in the table personalization dialog.

The custom filter will also be overwritten when rebindTable is called on the SmartTable.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

initiallyVisibleFields.description:
CSV of fields that must be shown initially in the SmartTable as visible columns and in the order specified.
This property is mainly meant to be used when no LineItem annotation exists.
If you have fields in the XMLView they are always shown first; then, the columns are added based on the LineItem annotation and finally based on this property.
Note:
If both this property and the LineItem annotation exist, the order of fields cannot be guaranteed to be as mentioned here.
No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.
initiallyVisibleFields.helpDescription:

sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterGroupItem.description: Represents a filter belonging to a group other than basic.
sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterGroupItem.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new filterbar/FilterGroupItem. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getGroupTitle groupTitle} : string
    • {@link #getGroupName groupName} : string
    • {@link #getVisibleInAdvancedArea visibleInAdvancedArea} : boolean (default: false)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterItem#constructor sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterItem} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.filterbar.FilterGroupItem.helpDescription: Represents a filter belonging to a group other than basic.

validationError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.

smartVariant.description: Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization. Will be ignored if the advanced mode is set.
smartVariant.helpDescription: Identifies the SmartVariant control which should be used for the personalization. Will be ignored if the advanced mode is set.

sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart.description:
The SmartChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet property must be specified to use the control. This property is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which the chart UI will be generated. It can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Based on the chartType property, this control will render the corresponding chart.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.
sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new smartchart/SmartChart. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getEntitySet entitySet} : string
    • {@link #getSmartFilterId smartFilterId} : string
    • {@link #getIgnoredFields ignoredFields} : string
    • {@link #getRequestAtLeastFields requestAtLeastFields} : string
    • {@link #getIgnoreFromPersonalisation ignoreFromPersonalisation} : string
    • {@link #getChartType chartType} : string
    • {@link #getIgnoredChartTypes ignoredChartTypes} : string
    • {@link #getUseVariantManagement useVariantManagement} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseChartPersonalisation useChartPersonalisation} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getHeader header} : string
    • {@link #getPersistencyKey persistencyKey} : string
    • {@link #getCurrentVariantId currentVariantId} : string
    • {@link #getEnableAutoBinding enableAutoBinding} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getChartBindingPath chartBindingPath} : string
    • {@link #getShowDrillButtons showDrillButtons} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowZoomButtons showZoomButtons} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowSemanticNavigationButton showSemanticNavigationButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowVariantManagement showVariantManagement} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowDownloadButton showDownloadButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowDetailsButton showDetailsButton} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowDrillBreadcrumbs showDrillBreadcrumbs} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getShowChartTooltip showChartTooltip} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getShowLegendButton showLegendButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getLegendVisible legendVisible} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode} : sap.chart.SelectionMode (default: Multi)
    • {@link #getShowFullScreenButton showFullScreenButton} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseTooltip useTooltip} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getUseListForChartTypeSelection useListForChartTypeSelection} : boolean (default: true)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getToolbar toolbar} : sap.m.Toolbar
    • {@link #getSemanticObjectController semanticObjectController} : sap.ui.comp.navpopover.SemanticObjectController
  • Associations
    • {@link #getSmartVariant smartVariant} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:initialise initialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:beforeRebindChart beforeRebindChart} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:dataReceived dataReceived} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantInitialise afterVariantInitialise} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantSave afterVariantSave} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:afterVariantApply afterVariantApply} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:showOverlay showOverlay} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.VBox#constructor sap.m.VBox} can be used as well.
sap.ui.comp.smartchart.SmartChart.helpDescription:
The SmartChart control creates a chart based on OData metadata and the configuration specified. The entitySet property must be specified to use the control. This property is used to fetch fields from OData metadata, from which the chart UI will be generated. It can also be used to fetch the actual chart data.
Based on the chartType property, this control will render the corresponding chart.
Note: Most of the attributes are not dynamic and cannot be changed once the control has been initialized.

toolbar.description: A toolbar that can be added by the user to define their own custom buttons, icons, etc. If this is specified, the SmartChart control does not create an additional toolbar, but uses this one.
toolbar.helpDescription: A toolbar that can be added by the user to define their own custom buttons, icons, etc. If this is specified, the SmartChart control does not create an additional toolbar, but uses this one.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.
tooltip.helpDescription:
The tooltip that should be shown for this Element.

Can either be an instance of a TooltipBase subclass or a simple string.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

items.description: Flex items within the flexible box layout
items.helpDescription: Flex items within the flexible box layout

semanticObjectController.description: The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.
semanticObjectController.helpDescription: The Semantic Object Controller allows the user to specify and overwrite functionality for semantic object navigation.

persistencyKey.description: Key used to access personalization data.
persistencyKey.helpDescription: Key used to access personalization data.

displayInline.description: Determines whether the sap.m.FlexBox is in block or inline mode.
displayInline.helpDescription: Determines whether the sap.m.FlexBox is in block or inline mode.

showZoomButtons.description: Controls the visibility of the Zoom In and Zoom Out buttons.
showZoomButtons.helpDescription: Controls the visibility of the Zoom In and Zoom Out buttons.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

showLegendButton.description: Controls the visibility of the Navigation button
showLegendButton.helpDescription: Controls the visibility of the Navigation button

showDrillBreadcrumbs.description: Controls the visibility of the Breadcrumbs control for drilling up within the visible dimensions. If set to true, the toolbar header will be replaced by the Breadcrumbs control. This will also set the drill-up button to invisible.
showDrillBreadcrumbs.helpDescription: Controls the visibility of the Breadcrumbs control for drilling up within the visible dimensions. If set to true, the toolbar header will be replaced by the Breadcrumbs control. This will also set the drill-up button to invisible.

alignContent.description: Determines the layout behavior of container lines when there's extra space along the cross-axis. This property has no effect in Internet Explorer 10.
alignContent.helpDescription: Determines the layout behavior of container lines when there's extra space along the cross-axis. This property has no effect in Internet Explorer 10.

CSV of fields that is not shown in the list of available chart types.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

useVariantManagement.helpDescription: If set to true, variants are used. As a prerequisite, you need to specify the persistencyKey property.

useTooltip.description: Controls the usage either of the tooltip or the popover. If set to true, a tooltip will be displayed.
useTooltip.helpDescription: Controls the usage either of the tooltip or the popover. If set to true, a tooltip will be displayed.

busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is raised. See {@link sap.ui.core.Control#attachValidateFieldGroup}.

chartBindingPath.description: Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)
chartBindingPath.helpDescription: Specifies the path that is used during the binding of the chart. If not specified, the entitySet property is used instead. (used only if binding is established internally/automatically - See enableAutoBinding)

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link sap.ui.core.Configuration}.

renderType.description: Determines whether the layout is rendered as a series of divs or as an unordered list (ul)
renderType.helpDescription: Determines whether the layout is rendered as a series of divs or as an unordered list (ul)

height.description: The height of the sap.m.FlexBox. Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.
height.helpDescription: The height of the sap.m.FlexBox. Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.

direction.helpDescription: Determines the direction of the layout of child elements.

showDrillButtons.helpDescription: Controls the visibility of the Drill Up and Drill Down buttons.

showChartTooltip.helpDescription: Controls the visibility of the chart tooltip. If set to true , the chart tooltip will be shown when hovering over a data point.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

requestAtLeastFields.description:
CSV of fields that must be always requested by the backend system.
This property is mainly meant to be used if there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.
requestAtLeastFields.helpDescription:
CSV of fields that must be always requested by the backend system.
This property is mainly meant to be used if there is no PresentationVariant annotation.
If both this property and the PresentationVariant annotation exist, the select request sent to the backend would be a combination of both.
Note: No validation is done. Please ensure that you do not add spaces or special characters.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). See {@link sap.ui.core.RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData RenderManager#writeInvisiblePlaceholderData} for details.

useListForChartTypeSelection.description: Controls the visualization for chart type selection. If set to true, the list of available chart types will be displayed. If set to false and there are three or fewer available chart types, the chart types will be displayed as separate buttons in the toolbar. If there are more than three chart types, a list will be shown.
useListForChartTypeSelection.helpDescription: Controls the visualization for chart type selection. If set to true, the list of available chart types will be displayed. If set to false and there are three or fewer available chart types, the chart types will be displayed as separate buttons in the toolbar. If there are more than three chart types, a list will be shown.

alignItems.description: Determines the layout behavior of items along the cross-axis. "Baseline" is not supported in Internet Explorer 10.
alignItems.helpDescription: Determines the layout behavior of items along the cross-axis. "Baseline" is not supported in Internet Explorer 10.
